history.content: I recommend seeing an advisor for this given the seriousness of the situation. In addition, if you were planning on majoring in CS: "All courses taken for the major must be taken for a letter grade. Students must complete all the lower division course requirements with a passing letter grade to graduate". So, I believe you were not allowed to P/NP EE 16A as it is a lower division requirement.

children.subject: You can only retake the course if you get a NP.
Trust me, I will most DEFINITELY get a NP. Thank you for letting me know.

That's what I was thinking too. And about the letter grade for major requirements, I'm aware of it, but I was under the impression that if I took it P/NP I would just have to take it again later. Is that true?

history.content:
Hi,

This semester I'm taking EE16A, CS70, and Math 54. I need a specific grade in 70 to declare and I might be able to pull it off, but in my quest to get this grade I've started neglecting all of my other classes. I saw it early in EE16A and I decided to pass/no pass it, but I'm still taking 54 for a letter grade. I don't think the content is all too challenging by any means, but I haven't been dedicating time to learn the material at all. 

Here's the thing. If I can't declare CS my backup was Math, but I would have to get a C or higher in 54 and then take 55 (another discrete math course) to do so. But before I give up I want to make sure I give it my all to do well in 70, so I've decided not to spend anymore time on 54. Should I use my emergency drop on 54 or save it and take the F? I was sure that either way I would be able to retake the course for a better grade to contribute towards my math major, but I'm already considering grad school and I don't know how bad that F will look even if I retake it.

And another thing, how valuable is the emergency drop? I know we only get one, so would it be a waste to consider using it for this course?
history.subject: Emergency Drop Math 54 or just take F
